Description: Cylindrical gold bead of granulated openwork made of three superimposed circles of seven twin globules welded together and jointed by two intermediate series of seven single globules regularly distributed.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, From the desert surface around the site. (?)
Curator's comments: Compare the larger object 18294 (1887,0101.573), also from Tell Dafana.
One of the 40 gold earrings and fragments found "by the Bedawin who hunt the neighbourhood", mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 76 § 73
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 76 § 73) (?)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.83, p.186, pl.28)
